content:
You can record the feed costs in the Variable Expenses section of the template.

**Variable Expenses:**

| Category | January | February | March | ... |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | ... |
| Feed and Supplies | $______ | $______ | $______ | ... |

Under the "Feed and Supplies" category, you can break down the costs into separate lines for chicken feed and goat feed. Here's how you can record the expenses:

**Variable Expenses:**

| Category | January | February | March | ... |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | ... |
| Feed and Supplies |  |  |  | ... |
| ‣ Chicken Feed | $150 |  |  | ... |
| ‣ Goat Feed | $250 |  |  | ... |
| ... |  |  |  | ... |

By breaking down the feed costs into separate lines, you can track the expenses for each type of feed and get a better understanding of your farm's variable expenses.

Remember to update the "Total Variable Expenses" row to reflect the total feed costs:

**Total Variable Expenses:**

| Category | January | February | March | ... |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | ... |
| Total Variable Expenses | $400 |  |  | ... |

Now you can see the total variable expenses for the month, which includes the feed costs for both chicken and goat feed.
